title: (x) "Spring Haven" handtooled/open script font - Troubadour Script (Rechtman) {Tina, Mike F}
content:
can anyone ID this font?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [spring.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20101219124007/http:/typophile.com/files/spring.jpg) | 5.47 KB |
author: evan

comments.content: Did you go to Bowfin.com and look through Mike's Script ID guide or even in-line faces? Go do some leg work
I don't know about any digital... but I think this is Troubadour Script (Light)

Yes I did. His site is helpful and I always go there first when trying to ID a script font. It is very valuable. However, some of the previews there are too small to see the fine detail necessary to id some fonts.
This is Troubadour Script (Light), but I can't post a sample.....

David Rakowski long ago digitized Troubadour Light as [Rechtman](http://web.archive.org/web/20101219124007/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/rakowski/dr5/davy_f5.htm). He worked on and released his fonts in Mac format (and then PC conversions showed up). [Here](http://web.archive.org/web/20101219124007/http:/www.erik.co.uk/font/script.html) is the original with documentation (no longer valid).
